oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from Cpl. Henry Marshall Misemer, Co. F, 3rd Tenn. Cav. Regt., USA, to wife Martha
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Letter written on United States Sanitary Commission stationery. Misemer states that he has been absent 6 months from the Federal lines while he was in Cahaba Prison in Alabama. He compares it to Purgatory. He goes on to state that all the boys from his company are in prison with him. Several have left with the sick and wounded and are headed to Savannah, but were stopped by Sherman in Macon. Misemer was captured near Athens, Alabama, by Gen. Nathan Bedford Forrest. See also TSLA Mf. #2008.
